snippet: Flint will receive $6 million in state funds to help switch its drinking water source after lead was found.
abstract: Michigan Gov Rick Snyder approves almost $9.4 million in aid for water filters, inspections and lab testing, $6 million of which will go to Flint; city is switching from Flint River as drinking water source following revelations water contained elevated levels of lead.
lead_paragraph: Flint will receive $6 million in state funds to help switch its drinking water source after lead was found.

headline.print_headline: Michigan: Flint Will Receive Money to Switch Source of Drinking Water
headline.main: Michigan: Flint Will Receive Money to Switch Source of Drinking Water
